item.ptxt: Lack of power caused by abnormal fuel injection volume (fuel supply pump assembly malfunction, fuel injector malfunction, etc.)
Lack of power caused by intake air volume shortage (turbocharger malfunction or exhaust manifold converter sub-assembly blocked)
Injector sliding malfunction
Injector stuck closed
Injector stuck open
Deposits in injector
Injector circuit malfunction
Suction control valve
Intake system leakage or clogged
Turbocharger sub-assembly
Front exhaust pipe blockage
EGR valve does not close
Throttle valve does not open
Pressure discharge valve (P1271 stored simultaneously)
Intake air system blockage
EGR system
Fuel filter element assembly is clogged
Throttle valve
Mass air flow meter sub-assembly
Compression pressure
Injector compensation code
Fuel leak
Glow plug
Fuel pressure sensor
Manifold absolute pressure sensor
Vacuum hose connection for manifold absolute pressure sensor
Vehicle modifications
Clutch disc wear
Low quality fuel
Frozen fuel
ECM

Specified values in the following troubleshooting flowchart are for reference only. Variations in the Data List values may occur depending on the measuring conditions or the vehicle's age. Do not judge the vehicle to be normal even when the Data List values indicate a standard level. There are possibly some concealed factors causing the malfunction.
Check that the vehicle has not been modified in any way prior to the vehicle inspection.
This troubleshooting procedure checks for the cause of an obvious lack of engine power while the vehicle is being driven (such as the maximum speed being extremely low).

step1.ptxt: Faults and Symptoms of Common Rail Diesel Components

entry.ptxt: Decrease in performance (foreign matter is stuck)

atten4.ptxt: The maximum fuel injection volume is controlled according to the output from the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.

item.ptxt: Lack of power (no black smoke) due to air filter blockage or crushed or leaking air duct
Black smoke (no lack of power) due to leakage between the turbo and intake manifold
MAP
Target Booster Pressure
When the accelerator is fully depressed, if MAP is 20 kPa lower than Target Booster Pressure for more than 5 seconds, then a lack of power will be felt.
MAF
Air leak in the turbocharged air passage
Turbocharger sub-assembly (turbine, bearing, variable nozzle)

entry.ptxt: Lack of power (when vehicle is starting, under heavy load)
(Black smoke is not emitted when racing while vehicle is stopped)

item.ptxt: When the accelerator is fully depressed, if MAP is 20 kPa lower than Target Booster Pressure for more than 5 seconds, then a lack of power will be felt.

With the ignition switch ON or during idling, MAP = atmospheric pressure (standard atmospheric pressure = 101 kPa). When the engine speed is about 1500 rpm or more, the turbocharger starts to take effect and MAP becomes higher than atmospheric pressure.
Atmospheric pressure decreases by 1 kPa each time elevation increases by 100 m, and is also affected by the current weather conditions.

entry.ptxt: Lack of power (high engine speed, under heavy load)
When the accelerator is fully depressed, if MAP is 20 kPa lower than Target Booster Pressure for more than 5 seconds, then a lack of power will be felt.
Difficult to start, rough idle, knocking, white smoke (when cold)

item.ptxt: Measure the resistance of the glow plug
Check the glow plug indicator light

entry.ptxt: Cannot crank, crank speed is low, strange noise

item.ptxt: When cranking during the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test, if there is a high speed cylinder, approx. 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, that cylinder may lose compression.
When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder.

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start, engine stalling, rough idle, lack of power
Common Rail Pressure, Target Common Rail Pressure, Target Pump SCV Current

item.ptxt: Common Rail Pressure is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (engine coolant temperature is higher than 75°C (167°F)).
If the fuel pressure is 20000 kPa below the target pressure, then a lack of power will be felt.
If the fuel pressure is below 25000 kPa, then idling will be rough.
The fuel pressure changes at engine start, but is approx. 25000 kPa at engine start after the engine is warmed up.
When Target Pump SCV Current is 3000 mA or higher, the suction control valve has a tendency to become stuck.

entry.ptxt: Even if Common Rail Pressure is below Target Common Rail Pressure, a DTC will not be stored.
Difficult to start, engine stalling, rough idle, lack of power
Common Rail Pressure, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Common Rail Pressure is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (engine coolant temperature is higher than 75°C (167°F)).
If the fuel pressure is 20000 kPa below the target pressure, then a lack of power will be felt.
If the fuel pressure is below 25000 kPa, then idling will be rough.

atten4.ptxt: The fuel pressure changes at engine start, but is approx. 25000 kPa at engine start after the engine is warmed up.

entry.ptxt: Even if Common Rail Pressure is below Target Common Rail Pressure, a DTC will not be stored.
Rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking

item.ptxt: When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder. This value can be read after idling for 1 minute.

entry.ptxt: Circuit fault: The fuel injector does not open.
Difficult to start, rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking
When the injector driver has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Open circuit, decrease in performance (foreign matter is stuck)
Difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, lack of power
Common Rail Pressure, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Common Rail Pressure is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (engine coolant temperature is higher than 75°C (167°F)).

entry.ptxt: When the fuel pressure sensor has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Difficult to start, rough idle (especially when cold)

item.ptxt: Does not move smoothly
Does not close fully
Rough Idle
EGR valve stuck closed: A loud turbocharger sound.

EGR valve stuck open: Difficult to start (does not stall), black smoke, white smoke (when the engine is cold), lack of power, jerking (If there is an excess in the quantity of EGR and there is a heavy load, when the vehicle starts moving, a lack of power will be felt. Also, when racing the engine, there will be some black smoke).

entry.ptxt: Actual EGR Valve Pos, Target EGR Valve Pos

item.ptxt: Generally, Actual EGR Valve Pos = Target EGR Valve Pos +/-5% (fully closed: 0%, fully open: 100%).

Using the EGR valve Active Test, check whether Actual EGR Valve Pos follows Target EGR Valve Pos (the engine coolant temperature and intake air temperature should be considered when a malfunction occurs).
EGR valve is fully closed when the ignition switch is ON (engine stopped).
EGR valve opens to the halfway point at idling after the engine is warmed up.

When the EGR valve does not close, MAF (Mass Air Flow) decreases when the vehicle is accelerated at full throttle. MAP also decreases in comparison to Target Booster Pressure, however there is not a large difference.
When leaving the vehicle idling, the normal range of EGR Close Lrn. Val. is 0 to 1 V.
In cases when EGR Close Lrn. Val. is out of the normal range (0 to 1 V), it is possible that the EGR valve cannot completely close.
Stuck closed: Lack of power, difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, black smoke. These may occur when stuck almost fully closed.
Stuck open: Turbocharger sound increases. When the engine is stopped, engine vibrations may occur.

entry.ptxt: Actual Throttle Position, Actual Throttle Position #2

item.ptxt: 0%: Fully closed
100%: Fully open

When the ignition switch is ON (engine stopped), the diesel throttle is fully open. When idling, the diesel throttle is at the halfway point. When the ignition switch is turned from ON to off, the throttle is fully closed temporarily.

step1.ptxt: Data List Related to Lack of Power

item.ptxt: Engine Speed
MAP
MAF
Intake Air
Coolant Temp
Target Common Rail Pressure
Common Rail Pressure
Target Pump SCV Current
Injection Feedback Val #1 (to #8)
Injection Volume
Actual Throttle Position
Actual Throttle Position #2
Target EGR Valve Pos
Actual EGR Valve Pos

entry.ptxt: The power of the diesel engine is determined by the quantity of injected fuel and the quantity of intake air.

The quantity of injected fuel is determined by the fuel pressure and the amount of time the fuel injector is open. Basically, the fuel pressure is controlled so that it reaches the target fuel pressure. The throttle valve does not restrict air flow volume, so the manifold absolute pressure is almost the same as the atmospheric pressure when idling. At more than approximately 1500 rpm, the turbo starts to operate causing the manifold absolute pressure to become higher than the atmospheric pressure.

The manifold absolute pressure is controlled so that it reaches the Target Booster Pressure when accelerating the vehicle at full throttle. Also, when accelerating the vehicle at full throttle, the throttle is fully open and the EGR valve is fully closed, preserving the mass air flow.

atten3.ptxt: After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration (Click here ).

item.ptxt: After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (See page ) and initialization (See page ).
After replacing the fuel supply pump assembly, the ECM needs initialization.
Click here
After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: READ OUTPUT DTCS (RELATING TO ENGINE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the pending DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

atten4.ptxt: If only DTC P1608 is output, proceed to step 2.

testgrp.testtitle: TAKE SNAPSHOT DURING IDLING AND 4000 RPM (PROCEDURE 2)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Diesel Lack of Power.
With no load after the engine is warmed up, take a snapshot when idling and at 4000 rpm.

item.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting.
The shift lever should be in neutral and the A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off.

testgrp.testtitle: TAKE SNAPSHOT DURING LACK OF POWER (PROCEDURE 3)

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Diesel Lack of Power.
Check for a lack of power during the driving test.

item.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting.

Move the shift lever to 2nd gear and accelerate the vehicle with the accelerator pedal fully depressed. Then, check the Data List with the engine warmed up and idling (the shift lever should be in neutral and the A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off).

atten3.ptxt: Obey all laws and regulations, and pay attention to traffic conditions while driving the vehicle.

entry.ptxt: Apparent lack of power is present
Apparent lack of power is not present

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SNAPSHOT (MAP AND MAF)

test1.ptxt: Check MAP and MAF in the snapshot taken in procedure 2 when the engine was running at 3000 rpm with no load.

entry.ptxt: MAF 68 gm/sec or more and MAP 110 kPa or higher*1

atten4.ptxt: The above values were measured under the standard atmospheric pressure. The values are influenced by elevation, weather conditions, etc.
The standard atmospheric pressure is 101 kPa. For every 100 m increase in elevation, the pressure drops by 1 kPa. This varies by weather.
*1: There may be a problem in the fuel injection system or intake system.
*2: There may be a problem in the turbocharger system.
*3: There may be a problem in the intake system or a problem with the EGR valve (valve stuck open or valve does not close).

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SNAPSHOT (MAP, COMMON RAIL PRESSURE AND TARGET COMMON RAIL PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Check MAP, Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure in the snapshot taken in procedure 3 when the vehicle was accelerating with the accelerator pedal fully depressed in 2nd gear.

entry.ptxt: MAP is below 150 kPa at an engine speed of 3000 rpm
Difference between Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure is 20000 kPa or more

item.ptxt: The above values were measured under the standard atmospheric pressure. The values are influenced by elevation, weather conditions, etc. The standard atmospheric pressure is 101 kPa. For every 100 m increase in elevation, the pressure drops by 1 kPa. This varies by weather.
The engine speed must be 1500 rpm or less before performing the inspection in which the accelerator pedal is fully depressed and the engine is accelerated to a speed of 3000 rpm.

If the turbocharger movement is not smooth, etc., the value of MAP in the snapshot taken during lack of power will not reach the target value. When the accelerator pedal is fully depressed and the engine speed is 3000 rpm, the MAP should be higher than 170 kPa.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check for air leaks and blockages between the air cleaner case and turbocharger sub-assembly, and between the turbocharger sub-assembly and intake manifold.

item.ptxt: Inspect the intake system, especially hoses and pipes between the air cleaner filter element sub-assembly and turbocharger sub-assembly.
Check for abnormal disconnections, pipe and hose squashing, and any damage in the intake system.
Using your hand, check whether the pipes and hoses in the intake system are securely connected.
By applying soapy water and revving up the engine, air leaks from the intake system can be checked by checking for bubbles.
Check for any modifications in the intake system made by the user.

testgrp.testtitle: CLEAN FUEL FILTER CASE AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ELEMENT ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Clean the fuel filter case and replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to clean the inside of the fuel filter case as the injector assemblies may not operate properly if the fuel filter element assembly is installed with foreign matter remaining inside the fuel filter case.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE INJECTOR ASSEMBLIES OF ALL CYLINDERS

test1.ptxt: Replace the injector assemblies.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: REGISTER INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE AND PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation code.
Click here
Perform the injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
COMPARE WITH SIMILAR VEHICLE WITH SAME ENGINE

test1.ptxt: Confirm the situation in which the lack of power was experienced by the customer again, and compare the driving feeling under the same conditions using a similar vehicle with the same engine while collecting data with the GTS.

atten4.ptxt: Confirm the state of the following conditions when the lack of power was experienced.

item.ptxt: Accelerator pedal position (vehicle load)
Vehicle speed
Engine coolant temperature
Ambient temperature
Driving conditions before the lack of power occurred
Climate
Road and traffic conditions
When (what day) the problem was noticed
Whether the problem occurs suddenly or gradually
How often the problem occurs
Why the customer felt there is a lack of power (e.g. the customer compared their vehicle with another vehicle, somebody told the customer that their vehicle has a lack of power, etc.)
Level of lack of power (slight or drastic)

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAP AND ATMOSPHERIC PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP and Atmosphere Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Compare MAP to Atmosphere Pressure when the ignition switch is ON (do not start the engine).

specitem.ptxt: Difference between MAP and Atmosphere Pressure is less than 8 kPa.

item.ptxt: If MAP and Atmosphere Pressure have the same value, both are normal. If there is a difference of 8 kPa or more, compare the values to the atmospheric pressure for that day. The sensor whose deviation is the greatest is malfunctioning.
The standard atmospheric pressure is 101 kPa. For every 100 m increase in elevation, the pressure drops by 1 kPa. This varies by weather.

entry.ptxt: MAP and Atmosphere Pressure have same value
MAP is different from actual atmospheric pressure
Atmosphere Pressure is different from actual atmospheric pressure

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check for air leaks and blockages between the air cleaner cap and turbocharger sub-assembly, and between the turbocharger sub-assembly and intake manifold.

entry.ptxt: Leaks and/or blockages exist in the intake system
No leaks or blockages in the intake system

item.ptxt: Inspect the intake system, especially hoses and pipes between the air cleaner filter element sub-assembly and turbocharger sub-assembly.
Check for abnormal disconnections, pipe and hose squashing, and any damage in the intake system.
Using your hand, check whether the pipes and hoses in the intake system are securely connected.
When inspecting for a clogged intake system (cause of low MAP), check the following points:
- Clogged air cleaner
- Clogged intake hose
- Diesel throttle valve stuck in closed position
Check for any modifications in the intake system made by the user.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the malfunctioning part in the intake system.

testgrp.testtitle: EXPLAIN THE INVESTIGATION RESULT TO CUSTOMER

test1.ptxt: Vehicle performance is normal. There is no problem at this point in time. However, if the problem reoccurs, ask the customer to explain in detail the situation in which the problem occurred. The best course may be to have the customer ride in another vehicle with the same specifications to understand that there is no problem with the customer's vehicle.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT TURBOCHARGER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Inspect the turbocharger sub-assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR INTERMITTENT PROBLEMS

test1.ptxt: Check for intermittent problems.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
INSPECT CLOGGED FUEL PIPE

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Target Common Rail Pressure and Common Rail Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: With no load after the engine is warmed up, take a snapshot when idling and the vehicle was accelerating with the accelerator pedal fully depressed in 2nd gear.
Check the Target Common Rail Pressure and Common Rail Pressure value.

entry.ptxt: While idling the vehicle, "Common Rail Pressure" deviates from the normal range and varies periodically with a period of approximately 2 seconds or more*1
"Common Rail Pressure" is normal while idling the vehicle, but "Common Rail Pressure" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure" when the accelerator pedal is fully depressed in 2nd gear*2

item.ptxt: *1: The cause may be a squashed or blocked fuel pipe or hose.
*2: The cause may be a clogged fuel filter.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE CLOGGED FUEL LINE

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the clogged (including frozen fuel) fuel pipe.
Replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: If "Common Rail Pressure" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure" when the accelerator pedal is fully depressed in 2nd gear, replace the fuel filter element assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Test the Fuel Leak / Data List / Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot with the GTS during the Active Test.
Measure the difference between the target fuel pressure (Target Common Rail Pressure) and the actual fuel pressure (Common Rail Pressure) when the "Test the Fuel Leak" Active Test is performed.

atten4.ptxt: In order to obtain an exact measurement, perform the Active Test 5 times and measure the difference once each time the Active Test is performed.

specitem.ptxt: The difference between the target fuel pressure and the actual fuel pressure 2 seconds after the Active Test starts is less than 10000 kPa.

item.ptxt: "Target Common Rail Pressure" is the target fuel pressure controlled by the ECM.
"Common Rail Pressure" is the actual fuel pressure.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE TURBOCHARGER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the turbocharger sub-assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel supply pump assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE MANIFOLD ABSOLUTE PRESSURE SENSOR

test1.ptxt: Replace the manifold absolute pressure sensor.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE ECM

test1.ptxt: Replace the ECM.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check for air leaks and blockages between the air cleaner cap and turbocharger sub-assembly, and between the turbocharger sub-assembly and intake manifold.

entry.ptxt: No leaks or blockages in the intake system
Leaks and/or blockages exist in the intake system

item.ptxt: Inspect the intake system, especially hoses and pipes between the air cleaner filter element sub-assembly and turbocharger sub-assembly.
Check for abnormal disconnections, pipe and hose squashing, and any damage in the intake system.
Using your hand, check whether the pipes and hoses in the intake system are securely connected.
By applying soapy water and revving up the engine, air leaks from the intake system can be checked by checking for bubbles.
Make sure that the hose between the manifold absolute pressure sensor and intake manifold is not loose or disconnected.
Check for any modifications in the intake system made by the user.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (ACTIVATE THE EGR VALVE CLOSE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up, and make sure the A/C switch and all accessory switches are off.
Turn the ignition switch off. Wait for 30 seconds, and then restart the engine.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value displayed on the GTS while the engine is idling.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Activate the EGR Valve Close / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value when the EGR valve is closed using the Active Test function.

item.ptxt: If idling continues for 20 minutes or more, the EGR valve target opening angle becomes 0% (EGR valve fully closed). As this makes diagnosis impossible, it becomes necessary to drive the vehicle or restart the engine.
Before performing the diagnosis, confirm that the EGR valve target opening angle is not 0%.

atten3.ptxt: As the measured values may differ from those shown below due to factors such as differences in measuring environments and changes in vehicle condition due to aging, do not use these values to determine whether the vehicle is malfunctioning or not.

atten4.ptxt: The problem may be a temporary one, due to the entry of deposits or foreign matter. Check that there are no deposits or foreign matter in the electric EGR control valve assembly or mass air flow meter.

item.ptxt: Atmosphere pressure: 101 kPa
Engine coolant temperature: 75°C (167°F)

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAF)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF and Engine speed.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and read the value when 30 seconds has elapsed.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (ACTIVATE THE VSV FOR EGR COOLER BYPASS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up, and make sure the A/C switch and all accessory switches are off.
Turn the ignition switch off and wait for 30 seconds.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value displayed on the GTS while the engine is idling.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass / Data List / EGR Cooler Bypass Position.

atten4.ptxt: Whether the EGR is passing through the bypass side or cooler side during the Active Test can be confirmed by checking EGR Cooler Bypass Position.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

app-param-unit.app-param: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

test1.ptxt: Using the Active Test function, switch the EGR valve bypass switching valve between "Cooler" and "Bypass" a few times, and then check whether the MAF value changes after switching the valve from "Cooler" to "Bypass".

atten4.ptxt: If idling continues for 20 minutes or more, the EGR valve target opening angle becomes 0% (EGR valve fully closed). As this makes diagnosis impossible, it becomes necessary to drive the vehicle or restart the engine.

entry.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass:

item.ptxt: If the EGR cooler sub-assembly is clogged, the mass air flow changes.
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch even with no clogging in the EGR cooler, the intake air flow will not change.
The bypass valve switch is determined by negative pressure changes and operating sound.
Vacuum inspection.
Click here
Operating sound inspection.
Click here
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch, perform the repairs listed below and replace the part. Then check for changes in the intake air flow by performing the Active Test again.
No. 2 EGR valve assembly
Click here
Vacuum hose connection
Click here
Vacuum switching valve assembly (for EGR bypass valve)
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REMOVE DEPOSIT (ELECTRIC EGR CONTROL VALVE ASSEMBLY)

test1.ptxt: Remove the electric EGR control valve assembly.
Click here
Visually check the electric EGR control valve assembly for deposits. If there are deposits, clean the electric EGR control valve assembly.

item.ptxt: When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, make sure the valve is completely closed.
When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, perform initialization procedure.
Click here
Do not forcibly open the valve, as it may be damaged or deformed.

When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, use a piece of cloth soaked with cleaning solvent. Spraying the solvent directly onto these parts or soaking the parts in the solvent may damage the parts.
If the EGR valve does not open properly or is stuck closed, the amount of intake air increases and combustion sounds and engine vibration may increase.

If the EGR valve does not close properly or is stuck open, EGR becomes excessive and combustion becomes unstable. Also, there may be a lack of power. In this case, clean the electric EGR control valve assembly.

test1.ptxt: Reinstall the electric EGR control valve assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the malfunctioning part in the intake system.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE EGR COOLER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the EGR cooler sub-assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
REPLACE MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.
Click here

item.ptxt: If foreign matter is stuck inside the mass air flow meter sub-assembly, the output characteristics of the mass air flow meter sub-assembly may change, resulting in a malfunction.
Before replacing the mass air flow meter sub-assembly, perform a wire harness inspection and if there are any problems with the wire harness, repair or replace it.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (ACTIVATE THE VSV FOR EGR COOLER BYPASS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up, and make sure the A/C switch and all accessory switches are off.
Turn the ignition switch off and wait for 30 seconds.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value displayed on the GTS while the engine is idling.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass / Data List / EGR Cooler Bypass Position.

atten4.ptxt: Whether the EGR is passing through the bypass side or cooler side during the Active Test can be confirmed by checking EGR Cooler Bypass Position.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

app-param-unit.app-param: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

test1.ptxt: Using the Active Test function, switch the EGR valve bypass switching valve between "Cooler" and "Bypass" a few times, and then check whether the MAF value changes after switching the valve from "Cooler" to "Bypass".

atten4.ptxt: If idling continues for 20 minutes or more, the EGR valve target opening angle becomes 0% (EGR valve fully closed). As this makes diagnosis impossible, it becomes necessary to drive the vehicle or restart the engine.

entry.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass:

item.ptxt: If the EGR cooler sub-assembly is clogged, the mass air flow changes.
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch even with no clogging in the EGR cooler, the intake air flow will not change.
The bypass valve switch is determined by negative pressure changes and operating sound.
Vacuum inspection.
Click here
Operating sound inspection.
Click here
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch, perform the repairs listed below and replace the part. Then check for changes in the intake air flow by performing the Active Test again.
No. 2 EGR valve assembly
Click here
Vacuum hose connection
Click here
Vacuum switching valve assembly (for EGR bypass valve)
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FRONT EXHAUST PIPE ASSEMBLY (CATALYST CONVERTER)

test1.ptxt: Remove the front exhaust pipe assembly.

item.ptxt: for 5 Door
Click here
Except 5 Door
Click here

test1.ptxt: Visually check for catalyst clogging or carbon deposits adhering to the inner wall of the exhaust pipe upstream of the catalyst.

specitem.ptxt: Less than 10% of the cells are clogged.

test1.ptxt: Reinstall the front exhaust pipe assembly.

item.ptxt: for 5 Door
Click here
Except 5 Door
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
REPLACE FRONT EXHAUST PIPE ASSEMBLY (CATALYST CONVERTER)

test1.ptxt: Replace the front exhaust pipe assembly.

item.ptxt: for 5 Door
Click here
Except 5 Door
Click here

atten3.ptxt: Perform initialization procedure for Catalyst Record Clear.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE EGR COOLER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the EGR cooler sub-assembly.
Click here
